column1: These settings affect all members in your community.
column2: These settings affect all members in your community.
These settings are applied on a per member level basis. Start by selecting the member level you want to modify, then adjust the settings for that level below.
Do you want to let users view events? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: No, do not allow photo events to be viewed.
column2: No, do not allow photo events to be viewed.

column1: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of photo events.
column2: Yes, allow viewing and subscription of photo events.

column1: Yes, allow members to view all events, even private ones.
column2: Yes, allow members to view all events, even private ones.

Do you want to let users create events? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply. This is useful if you want users to be able to view events and manage their subscriptions, but only want certain levels to be able to create events.

column1: No, do not allow events to be created.
column2: No, do not allow events to be created.

column1: Do you want to let users edit and delete events?
column2: Do you want to let users edit and delete events?

column1: No, do not allow events to be edited.
column2: No, do not allow events to be edited.

column1: Yes, allow  members to edit their own events.
column2: Yes, allow members to edit their own events.
Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can see their event. If you do not check any options, everyone will be allowed to view events.
Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can post to their event discussions. If you do not check any options, everyone will be allowed to post.
Your users can choose from any of the options checked below when they decide who can upload photos to their events. If you do not check any options, all members will be allowed to upload.

column1: Are you sure that you want to delete this event? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.
column2: Are you sure that you want to delete this event? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.

This page lists all of the event entries your users have posted. You can use this page to monitor these events and delete offensive material if necessary. Entering criteria into the filter fields will help you find specific event entries. Leaving the filter fields blank will show all the event entries on your social network.

column1: There are no events posted by your members yet.
column2: There are no events posted by your members yet.

If you want to allow your users to categorize their events, create the categories below. This feature is useful if you want to list all your users' event that If you have no categories, your users will not be given the option of assigning a event category.

column1: Are you sure that you want to delete this category? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.
column2: Are you sure that you want to delete this category? It will not be recoverable after being deleted.

column1: Do you want to let members edit and delete events?
column2: Do you want to let members edit and delete events?

column1: Do you want to let members delete events? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.
column2: Do you want to let members delete events? If set to no, some other settings on this page may not apply.

column1: Yes, allow members to delete their own events.
column2: Yes, allow members to delete their own events.

column1: No, do not allow members to delete their events.
column2: No, do not allow members to delete their events.

column1: Do you want to let members of this level comment on events?
column2: Do you want to let members of this level comment on events?

column1: Yes, allow members to comment on events.
column2: Yes, allow members to comment on events.

column1: No, do not allow members to comment on events.
column2: No, do not allow members to comment on events.

column1: {item:$subject} replied to a {item:$object:topic} in the event {itemParent:$object:event}: {body:$body}
column2: {item:$subject} replied to a {item:$object:topic} in the event {itemParent:$object:event}: {body:$body}
This email is sent to the member when they are approved to join an event.
You have been approved to join the event [object_title]

[header]

You have been approved to join the event "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when someone requests to join their event.
[sender_title] has requested to join the event [object_title]

[header]

[sender_title] has requested to join the event "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when people reply to discussion topics that the member created.
A member has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the event "[object_parent_title]"

[header]

[sender_title] has posted a reply to your topic "[object_title]" in the event "[object_title]":

"[message]"

Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
This email is sent to the member when people reply to discussion topics that the member replied to.
A member has posted a reply to the topic "[object_title]" you replied to in the event "[object_parent_title]"

[header]

[sender_title] has posted a reply to the topic "[object_title]" you replied to in the event "[object_parent_title]":

column1: Please click the following link to view it:

column2: This email is sent to someone when they are invited to an event.
You have been invited to join the event [object_title]

[header]

You have been invited to join the event "[object_title]". Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
